intro: Senecio velenovskyi, commonly known as the Velenovsky's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that are clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence. The leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in its native habitat.
